SENATE BILL No. 234

DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
Citations Affected:  IC 2-5-54-7; IC 6-8.1-7-1; IC 12-15;
IC 16-19-3-19; IC 22-4-19-6.
Synopsis:  Medicaid matters. Requires the office of the secretary of
family and social services (office) to report specified Medicaid data to
the Medicaid oversight committee. Requires the office to receive and
review data from specified federal and state agencies concerning
Medicaid recipients to determine whether circumstances have changed
that affect Medicaid eligibility for recipients. Prohibits the office from
accepting self-attestations of certain information in the administration
of the Medicaid program. Requires the office to apply for a Medicaid
state plan amendment to remove references to coverage under the
Medicaid plan of a certain population. Requires the office to establish:
(1) performance standards for hospitals that make presumptive
eligibility determinations and sets out action for when hospitals do not
comply with the standards; and (2) an appeals procedure for hospitals
that dispute the violation determination. Modifies eligibility categories
and requirements for the healthy Indiana plan (plan). Specifies
limitations for enrollment in the plan. 
Effective:  Upon passage; July 1, 2025.
Johns on T, Charbonneau
